summary: On January 31, 2000, Alaska Airlines Flight 261 crashed into the Pacific Ocean near California, killing all 88 people on board. The plane, an MD-80, was flying from Mexico to Seattle with a stop in San Francisco. The investigation found that the crash was caused by a broken part in the plane's pitch control system due to poor maintenance. The pilots tried their best to save the plane and were awarded medals for their bravery.
title: Alaska Airlines Flight 261
